item.title: Blog with Jupyter Notebooks!
item.description:
from IPython.core.display import Image
Image('https://www.python.org/static/community_logos/python-logo-master-v3-TM-flattened.png')


print("Welcome to Academic!")

Welcome to Academic!

Organize your notebooks

Place the notebooks that you would like to publish in a notebooks folder at the root of your website.

Import the notebooks into your site

pipx install academic
academic import 'notebooks/**.ipynb' content/post/ --verbose

The notebooks will be published to the folder you specify above. In this case, they will be published to your content/post/ folder.

item.title: Welcome to Hugo Blox Builder, the website builder for Hugo
item.description:
import libr
print('hello')

Overview

  1. The Wowchemy website builder for Hugo, along with its starter templates, is designed for professional creators, educators, and teams/organizations - although it can be used to create any kind of site
  2. The template can be modified and customised to suit your needs. It’s a good platform for anyone looking to take control of their data and online identity whilst having the convenience to start off with a no-code solution (write in Markdown and customize with YAML parameters) and having flexibility to later add even deeper personalization with HTML and CSS
  3. You can work with all your favourite tools and apps with hundreds of plugins and integrations to speed up your workflows, interact with your readers, and much more

Get Started

  • 👉 Create a new site
  • 📚 Personalize your site
  • 💬 Chat with the Wowchemy community or Hugo community
  • 🐦 Twitter: @wowchemy @GeorgeCushen #MadeWithWowchemy
  • 💡 Request a feature or report a bug for Wowchemy
  • ⬆️ Updating Wowchemy? View the Update Tutorial and Release Notes

Crowd-funded open-source software

To help us develop this template and software sustainably under the MIT license, we ask all individuals and businesses that use it to help support its ongoing maintenance and development via sponsorship.

❤️ Click here to become a sponsor and help support Wowchemy’s future ❤️

As a token of appreciation for sponsoring, you can unlock these awesome rewards and extra features 🦄✨

Ecosystem

  • Hugo Academic CLI: Automatically import publications from BibTeX

Inspiration

Check out the latest demo of what you’ll get in less than 10 minutes, or view the showcase of personal, project, and business sites.

Features

  • Page builder - Create anything with widgets and elements
  • Edit any type of content - Blog posts, publications, talks, slides, projects, and more!
  • Create content in Markdown, Jupyter, or RStudio
  • Plugin System - Fully customizable color and font themes
  • Display Code and Math - Code highlighting and LaTeX math supported
  • Integrations - Google Analytics, Disqus commenting, Maps, Contact Forms, and more!
  • Beautiful Site - Simple and refreshing one page design
  • Industry-Leading SEO - Help get your website found on search engines and social media
  • Media Galleries - Display your images and videos with captions in a customizable gallery
  • Mobile Friendly - Look amazing on every screen with a mobile friendly version of your site
  • Multi-language - 34+ language packs including English, 中文, and Português
  • Multi-user - Each author gets their own profile page
  • Privacy Pack - Assists with GDPR
  • Stand Out - Bring your site to life with animation, parallax backgrounds, and scroll effects
  • One-Click Deployment - No servers. No databases. Only files.

Themes

Wowchemy and its templates come with automatic day (light) and night (dark) mode built-in. Alternatively, visitors can choose their preferred mode - click the moon icon in the top right of the Demo to see it in action! Day/night mode can also be disabled by the site admin in params.toml.

Choose a stunning theme and font for your site. Themes are fully customizable.

License

Copyright 2016-present George Cushen.

Released under the MIT license.

item.title: Writing technical content in Markdown
item.description:
Hugo Blox Builder is designed to give technical content creators a seamless experience. You can focus on the content and Wowchemy handles the rest.

Highlight your code snippets, take notes on math classes, and draw diagrams from textual representation.

On this page, you’ll find some examples of the types of technical content that can be rendered with Wowchemy.

Examples

Code

Wowchemy supports a Markdown extension for highlighting code syntax. You can customize the styles under the syntax_highlighter option in your config/_default/params.yaml file.

```python
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv("data.csv")
data.head()
```

renders as

import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv("data.csv")
data.head()

Mindmaps

Wowchemy supports a Markdown extension for mindmaps.

Simply insert a Markdown markmap code block and optionally set the height of the mindmap as shown in the example below.

A simple mindmap defined as a Markdown list:


```markmap {height="200px"}
- Hugo Modules
- wowchemy
- blox-plugins-netlify
- blox-plugins-netlify-cms
- blox-plugins-reveal
```

renders as

- Hugo Modules
- wowchemy
- blox-plugins-netlify
- blox-plugins-netlify-cms
- blox-plugins-reveal

A more advanced mindmap with formatting, code blocks, and math:


```markmap
- Mindmaps
- Links
- [Wowchemy Docs](https://docs.hugoblox.com/)
- [Discord Community](https://discord.gg/z8wNYzb)
- [GitHub](https://github.com/HugoBlox/hugo-blox-builder)
- Features
- Markdown formatting
- **inline** ~~text~~ *styles*
- multiline
text
- `inline code`
-
```js
console.log('hello');
console.log('code block');
```
- Math: $x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a}$
```

renders as

- Mindmaps
- Links
- [Wowchemy Docs](https://docs.hugoblox.com/)
- [Discord Community](https://discord.gg/z8wNYzb)
- [GitHub](https://github.com/HugoBlox/hugo-blox-builder)
- Features
- Markdown formatting
- **inline** ~~text~~ *styles*
- multiline
text
- `inline code`
-
```js
console.log('hello');
console.log('code block');
```
- Math: $x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a}$

Charts

Wowchemy supports the popular Plotly format for interactive charts.

Save your Plotly JSON in your page folder, for example line-chart.json, and then add the {{< chart data="line-chart" >}} shortcode where you would like the chart to appear.

Demo:

You might also find the Plotly JSON Editor useful.

Math

Wowchemy supports a Markdown extension for $\LaTeX$ math. You can enable this feature by toggling the math option in your config/_default/params.yaml file.

To render inline or block math, wrap your LaTeX math with {{< math >}}$...${{< /math >}} or {{< math >}}$$...$${{< /math >}}, respectively. (We wrap the LaTeX math in the Wowchemy math shortcode to prevent Hugo rendering our math as Markdown. The math shortcode is new in v5.5-dev.)

Example math block:

{{< math >}}
$$
\gamma_{n} = \frac{ \left | \left (\mathbf x_{n} - \mathbf x_{n-1} \right )^T \left [\nabla F (\mathbf x_{n}) - \nabla F (\mathbf x_{n-1}) \right ] \right |}{\left \|\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n}) - \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n-1}) \right \|^2}
$$
{{< /math >}}

renders as

$$\gamma_{n} = \frac{ \left | \left (\mathbf x_{n} - \mathbf x_{n-1} \right )^T \left [\nabla F (\mathbf x_{n}) - \nabla F (\mathbf x_{n-1}) \right ] \right |}{\left \|\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n}) - \nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n-1}) \right \|^2}$$

Example inline math {{< math >}}$\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n})${{< /math >}} renders as $\nabla F(\mathbf{x}_{n})$.

Example multi-line math using the math linebreak (\\):

{{< math >}}
$$f(k;p_{0}^{*}) = \begin{cases}p_{0}^{*} & \text{if }k=1, \\
1-p_{0}^{*} & \text{if }k=0.\end{cases}$$
{{< /math >}}

renders as

$$ f(k;p_{0}^{*}) = \begin{cases}p_{0}^{*} & \text{if }k=1, \\ 1-p_{0}^{*} & \text{if }k=0.\end{cases} $$

Diagrams

Wowchemy supports a Markdown extension for diagrams. You can enable this feature by toggling the diagram option in your config/_default/params.toml file or by adding diagram: true to your page front matter.

An example flowchart:

```mermaid
graph TD
A[Hard] -->|Text| B(Round)
B --> C{Decision}
C -->|One| D[Result 1]
C -->|Two| E[Result 2]
```

renders as

graph TD A[Hard] -->|Text| B(Round) B --> C{Decision} C -->|One| D[Result 1] C -->|Two| E[Result 2]

An example sequence diagram:

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
Alice->>John: Hello John, how are you?
loop Healthcheck
John->>John: Fight against hypochondria
end
Note right of John: Rational thoughts!
John-->>Alice: Great!
John->>Bob: How about you?
Bob-->>John: Jolly good!
```

renders as

sequenceDiagram Alice->>John: Hello John, how are you? loop Healthcheck John->>John: Fight against hypochondria end Note right of John: Rational thoughts! John-->>Alice: Great! John->>Bob: How about you? Bob-->>John: Jolly good!

An example Gantt diagram:

```mermaid
gantt
section Section
Completed :done, des1, 2014-01-06,2014-01-08
Active :active, des2, 2014-01-07, 3d
Parallel 1 : des3, after des1, 1d
Parallel 2 : des4, after des1, 1d
Parallel 3 : des5, after des3, 1d
Parallel 4 : des6, after des4, 1d
```

renders as

gantt section Section Completed :done, des1, 2014-01-06,2014-01-08 Active :active, des2, 2014-01-07, 3d Parallel 1 : des3, after des1, 1d Parallel 2 : des4, after des1, 1d Parallel 3 : des5, after des3, 1d Parallel 4 : des6, after des4, 1d

An example class diagram:

```mermaid
classDiagram
Class01 <|-- AveryLongClass : Cool
Class03 *-- Class04
Class05 o-- Class06
Class07 .. Class08
Class09 --> C2 : Where am i?
Class09 --* C3
Class09 --|> Class07
Class07 : equals()
Class07 : Object[] elementData
Class01 : size()
Class01 : int chimp
Class01 : int gorilla
Class08 <--> C2: Cool label
```

renders as

classDiagram Class01 <|-- AveryLongClass : Cool Class03 *-- Class04 Class05 o-- Class06 Class07 .. Class08 Class09 --> C2 : Where am i? Class09 --* C3 Class09 --|> Class07 Class07 : equals() Class07 : Object[] elementData Class01 : size() Class01 : int chimp Class01 : int gorilla Class08 <--> C2: Cool label

An example state diagram:

```mermaid
stateDiagram
[*] --> Still
Still --> [*]
Still --> Moving
Moving --> Still
Moving --> Crash
Crash --> [*]
```

renders as

stateDiagram [*] --> Still Still --> [*] Still --> Moving Moving --> Still Moving --> Crash Crash --> [*]

Todo lists

You can even write your todo lists in Markdown too:

- [x] Write math example
 - [x] Write diagram example
- [ ] Do something else

renders as

  • Write math example
    • Write diagram example
  • Do something else

Tables

Save your spreadsheet as a CSV file in your page’s folder and then render it by adding the Table shortcode to your page:

{{< table path="results.csv" header="true" caption="Table 1: My results" >}}

renders as

customer_id score
1 0
2 0.5
3 1
Table 1: My results

Callouts

Academic supports a shortcode for callouts, also referred to as asides, hints, or alerts. By wrapping a paragraph in {{% callout note %}} ... {{% /callout %}}, it will render as an aside.

{{% callout note %}}
A Markdown aside is useful for displaying notices, hints, or definitions to your readers.
{{% /callout %}}

renders as

A Markdown aside is useful for displaying notices, hints, or definitions to your readers.

Spoilers

Add a spoiler to a page to reveal text, such as an answer to a question, after a button is clicked.

{{< spoiler text="Click to view the spoiler" >}}
You found me!
{{< /spoiler >}}

renders as

Click to view the spoiler

You found me!

Icons

Academic enables you to use a wide range of icons from Font Awesome and Academicons in addition to emojis.

Here are some examples using the icon shortcode to render icons:

{{< icon name="terminal" pack="fas" >}} Terminal
{{< icon name="python" pack="fab" >}} Python
{{< icon name="r-project" pack="fab" >}} R

renders as

Terminal
Python
R

Did you find this page helpful? Consider sharing it 🙌

<script>// Pandoc 2.9 adds attributes on both header and div. We remove the former (to
// be compatible with the behavior of Pandoc < 2.8).
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function(e) {
var hs = document.querySelectorAll("div.section[class*='level'] > :first-child");
var i, h, a;
for (i = 0; i < hs.length; i++) {
h = hs[i];
if (!/^h[1-6]$/i.test(h.tagName)) continue; // it should be a header h1-h6
a = h.attributes;
while (a.length > 0) h.removeAttribute(a[0].name);
}
});
</script>

<body>
<div class="slide titlepage">
<h1 class="title">CFPS data analysis</h1>
<p class="author">
Lin Wenzheng
</p>
<p class="date">2024-11-05</p>
</div>
<div id="research-question" class="slide section level2">
<h1>Research Question</h1>
<ul>
<li>The effect of parenting motivation on pro-environmental
behaviors</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div id="parenting-motivation" class="slide section level2">
<h1>Parenting motivation</h1>
<ul>
<li><p>抚育动机(parenting motivation)，或抚育动机系统(parental care
motivational
system)，是指一系列旨在照顾脆弱的年幼儿的情感和认知机制(Buckels et
al.,2015; Griskevicius & Kenrick, 2013; Li et al., 2019)</p></li>
<li><p>CFPS 2018: qka202</p></li>
</ul>
<pre><code>## [1] "期望孩子数（个）"</code></pre>
<ul>
<li>CFPS 2020: qq9013</li>
</ul>
<pre><code>## [1] "照顾孩子时长（小时/天）"</code></pre>
</div>
<div id="parenting-motivation-on-pro-environmental-behaviors" class="slide section level2">
<h1>Parenting motivation on pro-environmental behaviors</h1>
<ul>
<li><p>抚育是人类繁衍和生存的重要行为 (Geary 2000; Hill and Hurtado
1996)</p></li>
<li><p>抚育动机是促发这一行为的内在心理机制 (Buckels et al. 2015;
Griskevicius and Kenrick 2013; Kenrick et al. 2010)</p></li>
<li><p>因此，高抚育动机使个体更关注后代和人类长久福祉，更能规避短视而破坏人类长期利益的行为</p></li>
<li><p>环保行为试图保障环境的可持续性，维护人类的长期生存环境 (Tian
& Liu, 2022)</p></li>
<li><p>家庭人均水电与能源支出；控制家庭年收入与支出</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb3"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb3-1"><a href="#cb3-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">lapply</span>(df2[, <span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="st">"fp402"</span>,<span class="st">"fp403"</span>,<span class="st">"fp404"</span>,<span class="st">"fml_count.x"</span>)], <span class="cf">function</span>(x) <span class="fu">attr</span>(x, <span class="st">"label"</span>))</span></code></pre></div>
<pre><code>## $fp402
## [1] "每月水费（元）"
##
## $fp403
## [1] "每月电费（元）"
##
## $fp404
## [1] "每月燃料费（元）"
##
## $fml_count.x
## [1] "加载变量：2018年家庭成员人数"</code></pre>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb5"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb5-1"><a href="#cb5-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># lapply(df2[, c("finc","finc_est","finc1")], function(x) attr(x, "label"))</span></span>
<span id="cb5-2"><a href="#cb5-2" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># lapply(df2[, c("fexp","fexp_est","fexp1")], function(x) attr(x, "label"))</span></span></code></pre></div>
</div>
<div id="correlation-matrix" class="slide section level2">
<h1>Correlation matrix</h1>
<ul>
<li><p>由于CFPS数据为家庭调查嵌套数据，相关矩阵使用第二层数据</p>
<ul>
<li>部分第二层数据（家庭）为第一层数据（个体）aggregate 得到</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb6"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb6-1"><a href="#cb6-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co"># lapply(df2[, c("qka202","qn6012","finc_corrected","fexp_corrected")], function(x) attr(x, "label"))</span></span>
<span id="cb6-2"><a href="#cb6-2" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">pairs.panels</span>(df5[,<span class="fu">c</span>(<span class="dv">6</span>,<span class="dv">8</span>,<span class="dv">16</span>,<span class="dv">11</span>,<span class="dv">13</span>,<span class="dv">14</span>)], <span class="at">stars =</span> <span class="cn">TRUE</span>)</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img role="img" src="data:image/png;base64," width="960" /></p>
</div>
<div id="data-nesting-in-provinces" class="slide section level2">
<h1>Data Nesting in Provinces</h1>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb7"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb7-1"><a href="#cb7-1" tabindex="-1"></a>my.lme0 <span class="ot"><-</span> <span class="fu">lmer</span>(env_expavg2 <span class="sc">~</span> (<span class="dv">1</span><span class="sc">|</span>provcd18.r),<span class="at">data=</span>df5,<span class="at">REML=</span>F)</span>
<span id="cb7-2"><a href="#cb7-2" tabindex="-1"></a>ICC_cal <span class="ot"><-</span> <span class="fu">as.data.frame</span>(<span class="fu">VarCorr</span>(my.lme0))</span>
<span id="cb7-3"><a href="#cb7-3" tabindex="-1"></a>ICC_cal[<span class="dv">1</span>,<span class="st">"sdcor"</span>]<span class="sc">/</span>ICC_cal[<span class="dv">2</span>,<span class="st">"sdcor"</span>]</span></code></pre></div>
<pre><code>## [1] 0.2067446</code></pre>
<ul>
<li>省份嵌套的 ICC = 20.67%; 故使用多层线性模型分析</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="slide section level2">
<h3 id="自变量期望孩子数个家庭所有成员平均">自变量：期望孩子数（个；家庭所有成员平均）</h3>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb9"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb9-1"><a href="#cb9-1" tabindex="-1"></a>my.lme1 <span class="ot"><-</span> <span class="fu">lmer</span>(env_expavg2 <span class="sc">~</span> <span class="fu">scale</span>(qka202) <span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(age) <span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(finc_corrected)<span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(fexp_corrected)<span class="sc">+</span> (<span class="dv">1</span><span class="sc">|</span>provcd18.r),<span class="at">data=</span>df5,<span class="at">REML=</span>F)</span>
<span id="cb9-2"><a href="#cb9-2" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">summary</span>(my.lme1)</span></code></pre></div>
<pre><code>## Linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood . t-tests use Satterthwaite's
## method [lmerModLmerTest]
## Formula: env_expavg2 ~ scale(qka202) + scale(age) + scale(finc_corrected) +
## scale(fexp_corrected) + (1 | provcd18.r)
## Data: df5
##
## AIC BIC logLik deviance df.resid
## 110164.8 110214.9 -55075.4 110150.8 9513
##
## Scaled residuals:
## Min 1Q Median 3Q Max
## -2.1466 -0.5068 -0.2331 0.1955 30.5550
##
## Random effects:
## Groups Name Variance Std.Dev.
## provcd18.r (Intercept) 202.4 14.23
## Residual 6159.1 78.48
## Number of obs: 9520, groups: provcd18.r, 55
##
## Fixed effects:
## Estimate Std. Error df t value Pr(>|t|)
## (Intercept) 77.2574 2.6950 39.1339 28.667 < 2e-16 ***
## scale(qka202) -3.5126 0.8928 9423.0613 -3.935 8.40e-05 ***
## scale(age) 3.6627 0.8912 9454.7481 4.110 3.99e-05 ***
## scale(finc_corrected) 7.2911 1.0390 9508.1946 7.017 2.42e-12 ***
## scale(fexp_corrected) 2.8007 1.0014 9504.5029 2.797 0.00517 **
## ---
## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
##
## Correlation of Fixed Effects:
## (Intr) s(202) scl(g) scl(fn_)
## scal(qk202) -0.006
## scale(age) 0.031 -0.319
## scl(fnc_cr) -0.001 0.039 0.080
## scl(fxp_cr) -0.004 0.004 0.046 -0.530</code></pre>
<ul>
<li>期望孩子数显著负向预测了家庭水电能源支出（2018）</li>
</ul>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb11"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb11-1"><a href="#cb11-1" tabindex="-1"></a>my.lme2 <span class="ot"><-</span> <span class="fu">lmer</span>(env_expavg2_20 <span class="sc">~</span> <span class="fu">scale</span>(qka202) <span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(age) <span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(finc_corrected_20)<span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(fexp_corrected_20)<span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(finc_corrected)<span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(fexp_corrected)<span class="sc">+</span> (<span class="dv">1</span><span class="sc">|</span>provcd18.r),<span class="at">data=</span>df6,<span class="at">REML=</span>F)</span>
<span id="cb11-2"><a href="#cb11-2" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">summary</span>(my.lme2)</span></code></pre></div>
<pre><code>## Linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood . t-tests use Satterthwaite's
## method [lmerModLmerTest]
## Formula:
## env_expavg2_20 ~ scale(qka202) + scale(age) + scale(finc_corrected_20) +
## scale(fexp_corrected_20) + scale(finc_corrected) + scale(fexp_corrected) +
## (1 | provcd18.r)
## Data: df6
##
## AIC BIC logLik deviance df.resid
## 110801.3 110865.7 -55391.7 110783.3 9477
##
## Scaled residuals:
## Min 1Q Median 3Q Max
## -2.1013 -0.5167 -0.2491 0.2039 18.4463
##
## Random effects:
## Groups Name Variance Std.Dev.
## provcd18.r (Intercept) 318.1 17.84
## Residual 6855.1 82.80
## Number of obs: 9486, groups: provcd18.r, 55
##
## Fixed effects:
## Estimate Std. Error df t value Pr(>|t|)
## (Intercept) 78.9804 3.2305 38.6216 24.449 < 2e-16 ***
## scale(qka202) -2.5559 0.9401 9447.0779 -2.719 0.00657 **
## scale(age) 4.7265 0.9425 9446.5514 5.015 5.40e-07 ***
## scale(finc_corrected_20) 1.5163 1.0602 9478.4710 1.430 0.15271
## scale(fexp_corrected_20) 2.3765 0.9823 9456.6049 2.419 0.01557 *
## scale(finc_corrected) 5.3642 1.1441 9482.3137 4.689 2.79e-06 ***
## scale(fexp_corrected) 1.4582 1.0800 9457.8142 1.350 0.17699
## ---
## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
##
## Correlation of Fixed Effects:
## (Intr) s(202) scl(g) scl(fn__20) scl(fx__20) scl(fn_)
## scal(qk202) -0.006
## scale(age) 0.035 -0.310
## scl(fn__20) -0.002 0.032 0.069
## scl(fx__20) 0.000 -0.007 0.039 -0.368
## scl(fnc_cr) 0.000 0.021 0.043 -0.269 -0.075
## scl(fxp_cr) -0.001 0.001 0.031 -0.033 -0.088 -0.491</code></pre>
<ul>
<li>滞后模型：期望孩子数显著负向预测了家庭水电能源支出（2020）</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="slide section level2">
<h3 id="自变量照顾孩子时长小时天家庭所有成员平均">自变量：照顾孩子时长（小时/天；家庭所有成员平均）</h3>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb13"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb13-1"><a href="#cb13-1" tabindex="-1"></a>my.lme3 <span class="ot"><-</span> <span class="fu">lmer</span>(env_expavg2 <span class="sc">~</span> <span class="fu">scale</span>(qq9013) <span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(age) <span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(finc_corrected)<span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(fexp_corrected)<span class="sc">+</span> (<span class="dv">1</span><span class="sc">|</span>provcd20.r),<span class="at">data=</span>df5_20,<span class="at">REML=</span>F)</span>
<span id="cb13-2"><a href="#cb13-2" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">summary</span>(my.lme3)</span></code></pre></div>
<pre><code>## Linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood . t-tests use Satterthwaite's
## method [lmerModLmerTest]
## Formula: env_expavg2 ~ scale(qq9013) + scale(age) + scale(finc_corrected) +
## scale(fexp_corrected) + (1 | provcd20.r)
## Data: df5_20
##
## AIC BIC logLik deviance df.resid
## 21510.9 21549.5 -10748.5 21496.9 1822
##
## Scaled residuals:
## Min 1Q Median 3Q Max
## -1.7484 -0.5052 -0.2361 0.1916 15.0183
##
## Random effects:
## Groups Name Variance Std.Dev.
## provcd20.r (Intercept) 152.1 12.33
## Residual 7365.5 85.82
## Number of obs: 1829, groups: provcd20.r, 39
##
## Fixed effects:
## Estimate Std. Error df t value Pr(>|t|)
## (Intercept) 81.714 3.498 35.596 23.360 < 2e-16 ***
## scale(qq9013) -5.752 2.061 1828.203 -2.791 0.00531 **
## scale(age) -3.321 2.513 1828.781 -1.321 0.18655
## scale(finc_corrected) 3.864 3.467 1806.839 1.114 0.26528
## scale(fexp_corrected) 4.500 3.199 1829.000 1.407 0.15966
## ---
## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
##
## Correlation of Fixed Effects:
## (Intr) s(9013 scl(g) scl(fn_)
## scl(qq9013) 0.046
## scale(age) 0.172 0.200
## scl(fnc_cr) -0.016 -0.005 0.122
## scl(fxp_cr) -0.017 -0.041 -0.010 -0.730</code></pre>
<ul>
<li>照顾孩子时长显著负向预测了家庭水电能源支出（2020）</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div id="生育价值观降维" class="slide section level2">
<h1>生育价值观降维</h1>
<h3 id="生育价值观">生育价值观</h3>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb15"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb15-1"><a href="#cb15-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">KMO</span>(df_qme)</span></code></pre></div>
<pre><code>## Kaiser-Meyer-Olkin factor adequacy
## Call: KMO(r = df_qme)
## Overall MSA = 0.87
## MSA for each item =
## qme201 qme202 qme203 qme204 qme205 qme206 qme207 qme208 qme209
## 0.84 0.82 0.84 0.88 0.85 0.86 0.91 0.89 0.90</code></pre>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb17"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb17-1"><a href="#cb17-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="co">#scree(df_qme, pc=F) </span></span></code></pre></div>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb18"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb18-1"><a href="#cb18-1" tabindex="-1"></a><span class="fu">fa.parallel</span>(df_qme, <span class="at">fa=</span><span class="st">"fa"</span>)</span></code></pre></div>
<p><img role="img" src="data:image/png;base64," width="768" /></p>
<pre><code>## Parallel analysis suggests that the number of factors = 3 and the number of components = NA</code></pre>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb20"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb20-1"><a href="#cb20-1" tabindex="-1"></a>fa.fit <span class="ot"><-</span> psych<span class="sc">::</span><span class="fu">fa</span>(<span class="at">r =</span> <span class="fu">cor</span>(df_qme), <span class="at">nfactors =</span> <span class="dv">3</span>, <span class="at">fm =</span> <span class="st">"ml"</span>, <span class="at">rotate =</span> <span class="st">"promax"</span>) </span>
<span id="cb20-2"><a href="#cb20-2" tabindex="-1"></a>fa.fit</span></code></pre></div>
<pre><code>## Factor Analysis using method = ml
## Call: psych::fa(r = cor(df_qme), nfactors = 3, rotate = "promax", fm = "ml")
## Standardized loadings (pattern matrix) based upon correlation matrix
## ML1 ML2 ML3 h2 u2 com
## qme201 0.03 0.66 -0.02 0.44 0.56 1.0

<h3 id="生育价值观预测家庭水电能源支出">生育价值观预测家庭水电能源支出</h3>
<div class="sourceCode" id="cb24"><pre class="sourceCode r"><code class="sourceCode r"><span id="cb24-1"><a href="#cb24-1" tabindex="-1"></a>my.lme4 <span class="ot"><-</span> <span class="fu">lmer</span>(env_expavg2 <span class="sc">~</span> <span class="fu">scale</span>(age) <span class="sc">+</span> <span class="fu">scale</span>(finc_corrected) <span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(fexp_corrected)<span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(fermotiv1)<span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(fermotiv2)<span class="sc">+</span><span class="fu">scale</span>(fermotiv3) <span class="sc">+</span>(<span class="dv">1</span><span class="sc">|</span>provcd20.r) ,<span class="at">data=</span>df5_20,<span class="at">REML=</span>F)</span>

</ul></li>
